info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 3:59AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Laurens, southeastern Spartanburg, south central Cherokee and Union Counties through 430 AM EDT... At 358 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles south of Spartanburg to 14 miles northwest of Newberry. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Union, Clinton, Pacolet, Monarch Mill, Joanna, Buffalo, Jonesville, Pacolet Mills, Croft State Park and Rose Hill State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
